page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY SYCHDYN HALL
page.content: This Elizabethan Hall is situated 11 miles from Chester, 6 miles from Holywell and 4 miles from Hawarden. It was owned by a Mr Howard until 1912 when it was taken over by Mrs Alexander Reith Gray, who lived there until her death in 1942. It was then bought by a Mr Towers who has restored it to its original splendour.The buildings and grounds cover a total of 60 acres and include the main hall,a lounge, library, five large bedrooms, kitchen and scullery, a rare oak staircase and a butler's pantry. It also includes extensive gardens and farm out buildings. The house contains many priceless antiques collected by the owners including a unique set of bookcases made in 1790. The original Domesday Survey of 1085-6 noted the existance of a building on this site at that time.
